That's a great question. Here are some tips to avoid creating cliched or stereotypical characters:

1. Avoid relying on stereotypes: Don't rely on common stereotypes when creating your characters. Instead, give them unique and authentic qualities that make them stand out.

2. Make your characters complex: Try to avoid one-dimensional characters. Instead, make them complex and multi-faceted. Explore different aspects of their personality, motives, and actions to avoid stereotypes.

3. Use varied backgrounds: Characters from diverse backgrounds allow you to break away from traditional molds and create something fresh.

4. Identify your character's motivations: It's essential to understand your character's motivations, goals, and desires. This will enable you to create authentic behaviors and reactions to different situations, which will keep your characters from feeling like cliches.

5. Develop their backstory: Creating a back story gives characters depth and complexity. Understanding their past will allow you to create a unique personality that will stay away from the realm of cliches.

Ultimately, character development requires effort and intention. When writers approach their characters with curiosity and an open mind, they can create nuanced characters that feel authentic and real.
